themes: lack of clarity and stability in funding levels
need for transparent and criteria-based grant allocation
concerns about panelist expertise and selection
disconnect between funding recommendations and actual awards
key_phrases: Need to clarify and stabilize the funding levels
clear numbers that are connected with specific criteria
Not just a blanket applications for everyone
used to have peer panels that looked at specific genres
recent panelist had a lot of generalists who had no expertise
paying a bunch of unqualified folks, many not from Austin
reconsider the panelists: how many, who, what are we asking them to do
how is the scoring process explained
money awarded be connected through math to the actual funding recommendation
specific supplements to support the venues and keep them in business
barriers_identified: lack of transparent criteria for grant amounts
generalist panelists lacking expertise in specific art genres
panelists not from Austin adjudicating local projects
disconnect between scoring and funding recommendations
solutions_proposed: clarify and stabilize funding levels for all organization sizes
connect grant amounts to specific, transparent criteria
return to peer panels with expertise in specific genres
reconsider panelist selection and clarify their roles
make the scoring and funding process transparent and mathematically connected
provide specific supplements to support venues as cultural spaces
